p: The higher dose (10%) of aqueous fraction exhibited a higher percentage of wound closure at day 10 (93.5%), 12 (98.99), and 14 (100%). The corresponding wound closure percentages for 10% (w/w) ethyl acetate fraction were 92.8%, 97.1%, and 99.4% at the 10th, 12th and 14th days, respectively and the percentages of wound contractions exhibited by 10% (w/w) chloroform fraction at the 12th, 14th, and 16th days were 95.5, 98.8, and 99.8, respectively ( Figure 5).
